node.title: After Video Refutes Kelly’s Charges, Congresswoman Raises Issue of Race
node.abstract: Representative Frederica S. Wilson said John F. Kelly, the president’s chief of staff, lied by suggesting she had taken credit for obtaining funding for a federal building in Miami.
node.byline: By YAMICHE ALCINDOR and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

node.caption: James B. Comey, then the director of the F.B.I., left, with Representative Frederica S. Wilson next to him, at the 2015 ribbon-cutting ceremony marking the dedication of a new federal office building in Miami.

node.title: Conflicting Accounts in Niger Ambush Are Subject of Pentagon Investigation
node.abstract: Nigerien officials have said that a convoy gave chase to Islamic militants who later returned to ambush them, but American troops say they didn’t pursue the militants before the attack.
node.byline: By DIONNE SEARCEY, HELENE COOPER and ERIC SCHMITT

des_facet.node: United States Defense and Military Forces

node.caption: The coffin of Staff Sgt. Dustin M. Wright, who was killed in an ambush in Niger this month, at Dover Air Force Base in Delaware. American and Nigerien soldiers involved in the attack have given conflicting accounts.

node.title: Body Cameras Have Little Effect on Police Behavior, Study Says
node.abstract: An 18-month study of more than 2,000 officers in Washington found that those with cameras used force at about the same rate as those without.
node.byline: By AMANDA RIPLEY and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS

node.caption: A new study says that police body cameras have almost no effect on officer behavior.
A new study says that police body cameras have almost no effect on officer behavior.

node.abstract: Memory is a reconstruction, not a photographic recording. Our brains — unlike computers — are forever rerecording those memories.

node.title: A Rodin Hiding in Plain Sight in a New Jersey Suburb
node.abstract: A part-time archivist in Madison, N.J., found a signature on the back of a sculpture, setting her off on an investigation to confirm it was a genuine Rodin.

node.caption: A bust of Napoleon has stood inside the main meeting room in the borough hall in Madison, N.J., for 80 years. It turns out the sculpture was made by Auguste Rodin, the master French sculptor.

node.title: Amy Sedaris Is the Hostess With the Mostess. But Only on Set.

node.title: Omer Fast’s Chinatown Installation Is a Misfire
node.abstract: Part of the artist’s current solo at James Cohan’s Chinatown space, “August,” reads as nasty condescension.

node.caption: Omer Fast has transformed the James Cohan Gallery into a Chinatown shop or bus-company waiting room with broken A.T.M.s and a shabby facade.
Omer Fast has transformed the James Cohan Gallery into a Chinatown shop or bus-company waiting room with broken A.T.M.s and a shabby facade.

node.title: Selling the Porsche to Promote Iranian Art
node.abstract: Hamidreza Pejman, an Iranian entrepreneur, has poured his money into an exhibit space that he hopes will lift Tehran’s art scene to a global level.

node.caption: Hamidreza Pejman’s nonprofit foundation has been buying Iranian art and supporting dozens of Iranian and foreign artists for the last two years.
node.copyright: Arash Khamooshi for The New York Times

node.title: My Smartphone Died, and I Didn’t Miss It. Well, Maybe a Little.
node.abstract: A trip to Italy with a dead smartphone resulted in some predictable withdrawal pains, but also provided welcome respite from the clutter of information.

node.title: A Diabetes Monitor That Spares the Fingers
node.abstract: The device helps me control my glucose without pricking my fingers to test drops of blood. I buy it overseas, but it’s coming to America.

node.caption: The Libre device, about the size of a quarter, is placed on the arm and provides readouts of glucose readings.
The Libre device, about the size of a quarter, is placed on the arm and provides readouts of glucose readings.

node.title: Lack of Sleep Tied to Diabetes in Pregnancy
node.abstract: Women who slept less than 6.25 hours a night were almost three times as likely to have gestational diabetes as those who slept more.

node.title: Patents for Restasis Are Invalidated, Opening Door to Generics
node.abstract: The ruling, by a federal judge in Texas, is a setback for Allergan, which had transferred the patents to a Mohawk tribe in order to protect them.

node.caption: Four patents for the dry-eye treatment Restasis were invalidated by a federal judge on Monday. Allergan, the drug’s manufacturer, had sought to protect the patents by transferring them to a Native American tribe in New York State.

Four patents for the dry-eye treatment Restasis were invalidated by a federal judge on Monday. Allergan, the drug’s manufacturer, had sought to protect the patents by transferring them to a Native American tribe in New York State.

node.title: Inside a Secretive Group Where Women Are Branded
node.abstract: A self-help organization in Albany called Nxivm has begun to unravel as members reveal disturbing practices and fears of blackmail.

node.caption: Sarah Edmondson left Nxivm after being branded as part of a secret ritual.
Sarah Edmondson left Nxivm after being branded as part of a secret ritual.

node.title: College Advice I Wish I’d Taken
node.abstract: I’m a teacher, but as an undergraduate, I was the type of mediocre student I now disdain.

node.title: Stephen Sondheim, Theater’s Greatest Lyricist
node.abstract: Lin-Manuel Miranda speaks to the man who has consistently remade the American musical over his 60-year career — and who is trying to surprise us one more time.

node.caption: Stephen Sondheim at home in Connecticut.
Stephen Sondheim at home in Connecticut.

node.title: When the Revolution Came for Amy Cuddy
node.abstract: As a young social psychologist, she played by the rules and won big: an influential study, a viral TED talk, a prestigious job at Harvard. Then, suddenly, the rules changed.
